What happens to the coordination polymer when it is heated at 180 °C under 10^-5 Torr for 24 hours?
data.answer: It undergoes a single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformation, resulting in the removal of guest water molecules.

data.question: True or False: The size of the nanoparticles was affected by the concentration of metal ions, temperature, and type of solvent.
What is the role of Ni(II) ions in the formation of silver nanoparticles?
data.answer: Ni(II) ions are oxidized to Ni(III) state by Ag(I) ions, facilitating the formation of silver nanoparticles.

data.question: True or False: The structure of the coordination polymer is maintained even after the formation of nanoparticles.
What is the effect of removing guest water molecules from the coordination polymer?
data.answer: It results in extensive dynamic motions of the molecular components, involving rotation, swing, and bending motions.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymer is insoluble in common organic solvents such as MeOH, EtOH, and MeCN.
What is the effect of immersion of the coordination polymer in AgNO3 solution?
data.answer: It leads to the immediate color change of the coordination polymer and formation of silver nanoparticles.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymer produces monodispersed small Ag and Au nanoparticles at room temperature.
What is the significance of the redox-active property of the coordination polymer?
data.answer: It allows the polymer to react with certain chemicals to produce oxidized frameworks and reduced substrates.

data.question: True or False: The formation of gold nanoparticles was not affected by the immersion time in NaAuCl4 solution.
What happens when the coordination polymer is immersed in NaAuCl4 solution?
data.answer: The color of the host solid changes immediately, and Au nanoparticles are formed.

data.question: True or False: The void size of the coordination polymer is related to the size of the nanoparticles formed.
What is the role of Ni(II) macrocyclic complexes in the formation of nanoparticles?
data.answer: They are necessary for obtaining monodispersed and small Ag and Au nanoparticles.

data.question: True or False: The structure of the coordination polymer is altered after the formation of nanoparticles.
What is the effect of the concentration of Au(III) solution on the size of Au nanoparticles?
data.answer: As the concentration of Au(III) solution is further diluted, the Au nanoparticles become smaller.
